references.paper_title: A novel distribution-embedded neural network for sensor-based activity recognition
references.reason: This paper is foundational for sensor-based activity recognition using neural networks, a topic relevant to the current paper's focus on time series data.

references.paper_title: Beatgan: Anomalous rhythm detection using adversarially generated time series
references.reason: This paper introduces an adversarial approach to time series anomaly detection which is relevant to the current paper's use of adversarial methods in domain adaptation.

references.paper_title: Ts2vec: Towards universal representation of time series
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on universal time series representations, a key element in enabling effective knowledge transfer across domains.

references.paper_title: Distilling universal and joint knowledge for cross-domain model compression on time series data
references.reason: This is a highly relevant prior work by the same authors that lays the groundwork for the knowledge distillation techniques explored in the current paper.

references.paper_title: On minimum discrepancy estimation for deep domain adaptation
references.reason: This paper presents a method for deep domain adaptation using minimum discrepancy estimation, providing a relevant approach to handling the domain shift issue.
